data.AL: Container, Aluminum - Container must be made of aluminum
data.CD: Container with Bag Hangers - Rings or bars located in upper part of container walls to suspend bulk bags within the ocean container
data.DD: Double-Drop Trailer - A flatbed with two drop decks
data.DF: Container with Flush Doors - Container doors must be flush with the inside walls of the ocean-type containers
data.FN: Flat Bed Trailer with No Headboards
data.FS: Container with Floor Securing Rings - Appliances at floor level that can be used to secure cargo
data.HB: Container with Hangar Bars - Container must be equipped with hangar beams/bars for garment shipments
data.HY: Hydrant-Cart - Used at large airports with installed distribution systems to make into-plane deliveries; distinguished from other types of fueling vehicles
data.PP: Power Pack - A container holding a motor, generator, and fuel tank; used to provide power for refrigerated containers on a double stack train
data.RA: Fixed-Rack, Flat-Bed Trailer - A flatbed trailer with an A-frame
data.RD: Fixed-Rack, Double Drop Trailer - A double-drop, flatbed with an A-frame
data.RS: Fixed-Rack, Single-Drop Trailer - A single-drop, flatbed with an A-frame
data.SA: Saddle - Device to stack containers on a rail car
data.SD: Single-Drop Trailer - A flatbed trailer with one drop deck
data.SL: Container, Steel - Container must be made of steel
data.SR: STAK-RAK - A device upon which empty chassis may be stacked for movement "en bloc" on a railcar, stack train, trailer, or water-borne vessel
data.SS: Container with Smooth Sides - Walls in ocean container must be flat/smooth
data.SV: Van - Special Inside Length, Width or Height Requirements
data.TP: Trailer, Pneumatic - A specialized trailer with a pneumatic device for loading or unloading
data.TQ: Trailer, Electric Heat - A trailer with electric heat to keep product from freezing
data.TW: Trailer, Refrigerated - A refrigerated trailer capable of keeping product cold. Different from a temperature controlled trailer which is able to keep product at a constant temperature
data.UE: Trilevel Railcar Screened, With Doors, No Roof
data.UP: Container, Upgraded - Container must be upgraded for higher weights
data.VA: Container, Vented - Dry container must have vent openings for air exchange
data.WR: Container with Wavy or Ripple Sides - Walls must be wavy or ripple type
